TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit ActivationContext extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable, class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

remarks.para: The class contains an and provides internal-only access to the application manifest. The activation context is used during manifest-based activation to set up the domain policy and provide an application-based security model. For more information, see the class.

summary.para: Identifies the activation context for the current application. This class cannot be inherited.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.ActivationContext CreatePartialActivationContext(class System.ApplicationIdentity identity) cil managed

remarks.para: The method calls an internal constructor to create a new activation context. The implementation of the class in the .NET Framework version 2.0 is designed for applications that are neither fully installed in a store nor fully contained in a folder. This method provides backward compatibility for later releases in which public constructors provide full activation contexts.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified application identity.

returns.para: An object with the specified application identity.

Docs.param: An object that identifies an application.

MemberSignature.Value: public static ActivationContext CreatePartialActivationContext (ApplicationIdentity identity, string[] manifestPaths);
.method public static hidebysig class System.ActivationContext CreatePartialActivationContext(class System.ApplicationIdentity identity, string[] manifestPaths) cil managed

remarks.para: The method calls an internal constructor to create a new activation context. The implementation of the class in the .NET Framework version 2.0 is designed for applications that are neither fully installed in a store nor fully contained in a folder. This method provides backward compatibility for later releases in which public constructors provide full activation contexts.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified application identity and array of manifest paths.

returns.para: An object with the specified application identity and array of manifest paths.

Docs.param: An object that identifies an application.
A string array of manifest paths for the application.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

remarks.para: Call when you are finished using the . The method leaves the in an unusable state. After calling , you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. For more information, see Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources and Implementing a Dispose Method.

block.para: Always call before you release your last reference to the . Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's Finalize method.

summary.para: Releases all resources used by the .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Finalize() cil managed

summary.para: Enables an object to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before the is reclaimed by garbage collection.

remarks.para: A manifest-based application might not be installed in the ClickOnce store. An application that is not in the store, such as a manifest-activated application executing in vsprvs, is classified as . An application that is contained in the store is classified as .

summary.para: Gets the form, or store context, for the current application.

remarks.para: An uniquely identifies an application by its full name and location.

summary.para: Gets the application identity for the current application.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable.GetObjectData(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

summary.para: Populates a with the data needed to serialize the target object.
